net.happybrackets.core.control

Class BooleanControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.happybrackets.core.control.DynamicControlParent
      • net.happybrackets.core.control.BooleanControl
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanControlSender

    public class BooleanControl
extends DynamicControlParent
    This class encapsulates the functionality of DynamicControl classes of type ControlType.BOOLEAN in a simple API.

    All BooleanControl objects with the same name and ControlScope will respond to a setValue(Boolean). For example, consider two BooleanControls with the same ControlScope and name 
     BooleanControl control1 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false);
 BooleanControl control2 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false) {
     @Override
    public void valueChanged(Boolean control_val) {
        System.out.println("Read " + control_val);
    }
};// End DynamicControl control2 code

 control1.setValue(true); // Setting control1 will also set control2

    Will cause the valueChanged(Boolean) function to be called with the new value, causing Read true to be printed to standard output

    The control can also schedule messages to be sent at a time in the future by adding the time to the message using an absolute time in the setValue(Boolean, double) function. Eg:

    control1.setValue (true, HB.getSchedulerTime() + 1000); // this will set control1 value, as well as all other BooleanControls with same ControlScope and name, to true 1 second in the future


    Setting the value within the HappyBrackets controls display is effected using a checkbox, where a checked value is true.
    It is possible to get current value using the getValue() If you require a handler on the class, override valueChanged(Boolean) function

      • BooleanControl

        public BooleanControl(java.lang.Object parent_sketch,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.Boolean initial_value)
        Constructor for abstract FloatControl. Slider, Text and Buddy Control will derive from this class
        Parameters:
        parent_sketch - The parent object for control
        name - The name to Display
        initial_value - Initial value of the object

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Boolean getValue()
        Get the value for the control 
             BooleanControl control1 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false);

     boolean val = control1.getValue(); // val will be false
     control1.setValue(true);
     val = control1.getValue(); // val will be true
        Returns:
        the control value

      • valueChanged

        public void valueChanged(java.lang.Boolean control_val)
        Fired event that occurs when the value for the control has been set. This will pass the message on to all other DynamicControl with matching name, type and ControlScope and call valueChanged(Boolean). The function must be implemented when creating objects 
             BooleanControl control1 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false);
     BooleanControl control2 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false) {
        @Override
        public void valueChanged(Boolean control_val) {
            System.out.println("Read " + control_val);
        }
     };// End DynamicControl control2 code

     control1.setValue(true);// Setting control1 will also set control2

        Will cause the valueChanged(Boolean) function to be called with the new value, causing Read true to be printed to standard output
        Parameters:
        control_val - The new value of the control

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.Boolean val)
        set the value for the control. This will notify all the listeners with same name and ControlScope. For example 
             BooleanControl control1 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false);
     BooleanControl control2 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false) {
         @Override
        public void valueChanged(Boolean control_val) {
            System.out.println("Read " + control_val);
        }
     };// End DynamicControl control2 code

     control1.setValue(true); // Setting control1 will also set control2

        Will cause the valueChanged(Boolean) function to be called with the new value, causing Read true to be printed to standard output

        The control can also schedule messages to be sent at a time in the future by adding the time to the message using an absolute time in the setValue(Boolean, double) function.
        Parameters:
        val - the value to set to

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.Boolean val,
                     double scheduler_time)
        Identical to the setValue(Boolean) with the exception that the valueChanged(Boolean) event will be caused at the HBScheduler scheduled time passed in.
        For example, the following code will cause matching DynamicControl objects to respond 1 second in the future 
             BooleanControl control1 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false);
     BooleanControl control2 = new BooleanControl(this, "Read", false) {
         @Override
            public void valueChanged(Boolean control_val) {
            System.out.println("Read " + control_val);
        }
     };// End DynamicControl control2 code

     control1.setValue(true, HB.getSchedulerTime() + 1000); // Setting control1 will also set control2

        Will cause the valueChanged(Boolean) function to be called with the new value one second in the future, causing Read true to be printed to standard output one second in the future
        Parameters:
        val - the value to set to
        scheduler_time - the scheduler time this is supposed to occur at

      • setControlScope

        public BooleanControl setControlScope(ControlScope new_scope)
        Changed the ControlScope the object has has. It will update control map so the correct events will be generated based on its scope
        Overrides:
        setControlScope in class DynamicControlParent
        Parameters:
        new_scope - The new Control Scope
        Returns:
        this object

      • setDisplayType

        public BooleanControl setDisplayType(DynamicControl.DISPLAY_TYPE display_type)
        Change how to display object as DynamicControl.DISPLAY_TYPE
        Parameters:
        display_type - The new Control Scope
        Returns:
        this object
